metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7843 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When Private Browsing mode is used, it is possible for a web worker to write persistent data to IndexedDB and fingerprint a user uniquely. IndexedDB should not be available in Private Browsing mode and this stored data will persist across multiple private browsing mode sessions because it is not cleared when exiting. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.5.2 and Firefox < 57.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
